title: Kenshin Impact Game Website
description: This is a part of a final project for a web development course I was taking in college. The site consists of several pages that provides information about a fictional game called 'Kenshin Impact'. The technologies used to make the website are vanilla HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

title: Portfolio Website
description: This project was part of a frontend development class I had in my college. The task was to develop a portfolio website consisting of 4 pages, the home, about, contact, and projects page. A connection to a firebase database is also required to save messages from the contact form.

title: Profile Card Component
description: This project requires me to create a single webpage containing a card component. The card is filled with a picutre, name, age, and social media statistics of a person. For creating the project, I used vanilla CSS.

title: Random Animal Generator
description: This project is my first personal project where I use a public API for the content of the website. When creating the project, some note worthy technologies  used are modular SASS, vanilla Javascript, and BEM naming convention.

title: Sneakers
description: This project requires me to create a product page for an e-commerce website called Sneakers. The technologies used for the projects are vanilla Javascript and SASS. Similar to most of my other frontend mentor projects, I seperate my SASS files into parts based on the functionalities and also use BEM for naming classes and ids

title: Social Media Dashboard
description: I got the inspiration for doing this project by CoderCoder, which is a youtuber I often watch for front-end development content. Because of this project, I started to learn about modular SASS. It is because of doing this project did I start to use SASS for any frontend development I do in the future.

title: Stats Preview Card Component
description: This project is one of the first front end mentor projects that I have done and was created using vanilla Javascript and CSS. The project only requires you to create a card component containing content.

title: Sunnyside Agency Landing Page
description: The project is to create a landing page for a company, where the main challenge I encountered was to layout the sections properly and make the site both responsive and SEO friendly.

title: Tip Calculator
description: This project was quite unique as it requires me to implement a lot of features for calculating the neccessary tip and create a functional calculator. For creating the tip calculator, I used modular SASS, vanilla Javascript, and BEM naming convention for the class names.

title: Twitter Clone Front End
description: This project is the first front end project that I have ever done. Using only vanilla HTML, CSS and Javascript, I tried to create a front end for a twitter that has slight user interface differences with the original site.
